titleInfo.title: John Sales with friend in bunks

mods.accessCondition: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. mods.abstract: Sales with unidentified fellow Marine in the bunk area of the troopship General Nelson M. Walker on his way home in December 1967; these are the canvas bunks on the bottom of which Sales and other troop passengers left graffiti.

John L. Sales of Nashville, Tenn. (b. April 7, 1947) served in the United States Marine Corps from May 1966 to May 1968. A member of Co. A, 1st Battalion, 4th Rgt., 3rd Marine Division, he saw action in the northern sector of South Vietnam from December 1966 to June 1967. Wounded twice in combat, Pvt. Sales received the Purple Heart medal.
